intro: Lasiopetalum macrocarpum, commonly known as the broad-fruited rock rose, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature. Lasiopetalum macrocarpum is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
